intro: Whytockia chiritiflora var. minor, commonly known as the dwarf chiritiflora, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
